thread.title: Astros, Blue Jays win in ALDS Game 3s
thread.title_full: Astros, Blue Jays win in ALDS Game 3s

title: Astros, Blue Jays win in ALDS Game 3s
text:
Astros, Blue Jays win in ALDS Game 3s Published: Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 11:17 a.m. CDT 
HOUSTON, Texas (AP) — Dallas Keuchel remained perfect at home with seven gutsy innings and Chris Carter homered Sunday, leading the Houston Astros to a 4-2 win over the Royals to take a 2-1 edge in the American League Division Series. 
The Astros could wrap up the best-of-five matchup with a win over the defending AL champions in Game 4 on Monday. 
“You got to go out and win tomorrow,” manager Ned Yost said. “So, you just don’t have much leeway now, but our guys, I think, are up to the task and tomorrow will be an exciting day.” 
Luke Gregerson gave up a leadoff homer in the ninth to Alex Gordon before finishing off the Astros first playoff game in Houston in 10 years with a four-out save. 
Lorenzo Cain hit a solo homer in the fourth for the Royals, who were 0 for 7 with runners in scoring position and left 10 on base. 
Houston rookie Lance McCullers (6-7, 3.22) opposes Yordano Ventura (13-8, 4.08) in Game 4. 
Blue Jays 5, Rangers 1 
ARLINGTON, Texas (AP) — Troy Tulowitzki drove in four runs, including a three-run homer for his first hit this postseason, and the Toronto Blue Jays avoided elimination in the AL Division Series with a 5-1 win over the Texas Rangers in Game 3 on Sunday night. 
The Blue Jays cut their deficit to 2-1 in the best-of-five matchup.
